++++ [[span style="font-variant: small-caps;"]]News Time Capsule[[/span]]
The dynamic nature of this wiki means that pages get moved, renamed, deleted, and replaced.
Wiki links on old news pages have been made non-functional as many no longer point to the same content. External links are unaffected.
[[/div]]


Welcome to this installment of site news, where we present only the hottest articles!

This is a series showing off news from the site, articles from the past month[[footnote]] with a rating above 0 [[/footnote]], and fan-content for you to check out and discover! Be sure to leave a comment with your thoughts!

++++ Featured Articles

* The featured articles for July were [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2268[[/a]] ("Loaf Page") by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SpectralDragon[[/a]], [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Battle of the Toys: The Breakroom Routing[[/a]] by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Sad Xiao[[/a]], and [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Project Proposal 2004-024: My Father's Values[[/a]] by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Zolgamax[[/a]]. The first is about a website that burns bread, the second is about a pitched battle over the Foundation's toy chest, and the third is about a reality bender's brain on art. Check them out!

++++ Editor's Choice Articles

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3087[[/a]] ("The Owl-Car") - Round and round and round it goes. Where it goes, nobody knows... driven by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Chubert[[/a]]. //Chubert has a knack for dialogue and for taking seemingly innocuous objects to a disturbing conclusion. The Owl-Car is no different, and complements its character work with fantastically unnerving imagery. A terrific article that should be read by anyone seeking to write an exploration log.//
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Project Proposals 1964-011/1974-014[[/a]] - Some people make art for art's sake. Others make art for the sake of art. Documented by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Moklin[[/a]]. //In recent years, the GoI// Are We Cool Yet? //has received heavy criticism for a variety of reasons, chief among them being that their reasons for making art are beyond idiotic. This article is an utterly fantastic usage of the AWCY? GoI format that brings the group back to its ideal: art through anomalies. It explores two fantastically unique proposals, each with a distinct concept and voice, and combines them to form a consistent story with an interesting theme and a vivid sense of art. This article is not to be missed.//
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Hartliss Detective Agency[[/a]] - Hartliss's new case pits him against magical criminal syndicates and ancient flesh cults. Just another day in Chicago. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Great Hippo[[/a]]. //A fantastic noir story dripping with style. The metaphors and the visuals are crunchy and vivid, the characters are pulpy without being trite, and the action is tense without being intense. Hartliss also combines two GoIs that could not be more different - the anomalous crime syndicate Chicago Spirit and the mystic flesh cult Sarkicism - and makes it work, amplifying their strengths without carrying over their weaknesses. This editor gives it two mutant thumbs up.//

++++ Event Featured Articles

The theme for the month of July was //uncontained//!

* In [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2531[[/a]] ("The Pumpkin Man"), by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Jonathan Whitney[[/a]], there was something much worse than a worm in this fruit...
* In [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-1879[[/a]] ("Indoor Salesman"), by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]marslifeform[[/a]], a salesman refused to let the Foundation keep him from his job...
* And in [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2872[[/a]] ("A Fast Horse"), by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Freudian[[/a]], a horse was a horse of course but who rode was even more important...

++++ Rest of the News

* Posting has begun for the [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Social Media Art Contest[[/a]]! Posting will go from July 30 to August 30. Follow the link for the rules on submitting an entry!

Missing out on articles? Enjoy a recap on the articles from the past month.

+++ Week of July 1st:

Game on!

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-ROCKS-J[[/a]] ("A Pile Of Rocks That Need To Shut The Hell Up") - Talking rocks. Enough said. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Penton[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3301[[/a]] ("THE FOUNDATION") - //A GAME BY CRYOGEN STUDIOS (A DIVISION OF DR. WONDERTAINMENT)//. Game design by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]djkaktus[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3535[[/a]] ("Casus Lignum") - //Review of surveillance footage shows that all key personnel involved with monitoring and maintaining the plumbing system and SCP-3535 had unknowingly been affected by its leaves.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Roget[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3357[[/a]] ("Practice Makes Perfect") - Perfectionism is more damaging than this anomaly could ever be. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]rioludoodle[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3878[[/a]] ("Words Will Never Hurt Me") - //SCP-3878 is a semantic weapon developed by the Obskuracorps in 1938, derived from the study of anomalous conceptual objects retrieved from the Thule Society's expeditions into the multiverse.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Taffeta[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-8851-J[[/a]] ("Super Cheap Procedures") - Not even the Foundation is immune to budget cuts. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SpookyPizza[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3995[[/a]] ("Some Pretty Fishy Swimming Trunks") - What if your swimwear wanted to eat you? Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]RegularSlambo[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3046[[/a]] ("Hallucinogenic") - //The structures appear to be what once was an alien metropolis, with structures resembling churches and vast expanses of housing and farmland.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Nekromykon[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3602[[/a]] ("The Monkey King's Legacy") - Perhaps we were better off being unintelligent. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Modern_Erasmus[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3726[[/a]] ("AnthropomorFic") - Write it your way. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Flawed[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3088[[/a]] ("Law Of The Land") - What would you do if your word became law? The right thing? Or for the right reasons? Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Mortos[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3057[[/a]] ("Fossil Fuels") - //SCP-3057 is an anomalous phenomenon by which crude oil spontaneously transforms into instances of prehistoric species.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Great Hippo[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3325[[/a]] ("Live Entertainment") - Cartoons become real... and that's when things really go wrong. Animated by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]xFox[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3444[[/a]] ("She Took The Midnight Train Going Anywhere...") - Final destination - your broken dreams. Tickets checked by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Tufto[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3933[[/a]] ("Storm of Steel") - Though a man's hands may love a woman, plow a farm, and raise a family, they will still remember the grip of the rifle. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Rosa Braun[[/a]].

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Your Call Is Important To Us[[/a]] - A day in the life of customer support at Herman Fuller's Circus of the Disquieting. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]DrChandra[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]What Dragons We Shall Be[[/a]] - A man explores how to bend reality to his will. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SunnyClockwork[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]And Then, Kit Slept[[/a]] - //Kit may have believed that once, but now he had seen things and felt things and fucked things that no-one else knew of -// written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Zachary Maxwell[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]You're a Toy, Mr. Sanderson[[/a]] - The Foundation continues to put profits and efficiency over the wellbeing of its employees. A tale in the [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Broken Masquerade[[/a]], written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Cyantreuse[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The News Tonight: Wednesday April 26th 2017[[/a]] - //Many of our top soldiers gave their lives this evening, passing on their blood to Rakmou-leusan, so that he may receive our blood and hold us against these retched Voruteut who attack our borders. Praise be to Rakmou-leusan.// Coming to you live from [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]LordStonefish[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Channeling Flows[[/a]] - In the followup to [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Finding Balance[[/a]], the alchemist's apprentice learns the terrible history of the discipline. Followed by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Restoring Harmony[[/a]], all written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]DrMagnus[[/a]].

++++ Hubs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Glittering Horizon Hub[[/a]] - An experimental narrative about a murder mystery spanning multiple dimensions. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]LordStonefish[[/a]].

++++ Author's Pages

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Researcher Edward Flawrence's Personnel File[[/a]] - [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Flawed[[/a]]'s author page!

+++ Week of July 8th:

YOU ARE UNDER ATTACK

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3939[[/a]] ("The World is My Canvas") - //Its primary anomaly of note is the entity's tremendous and consistent speed of approximately 9500 kilometres per hour. How it achieves this speed is entirely unknown, as is the method by which it avoids damaging nearby objects, life forms or terrain when traveling.// Painted by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]bittermixin[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3443[[/a]] ("Placeholder") - There has always been nothing of note here. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]ProfessorAdonisCnut[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3553[[/a]] ("They All Go Into the Dark") - Don't turn out the lights. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Tufto[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2576[[/a]] ("Joseph and the Technicolor Dream Goat") - //I taste blood and steel. YOU ARE UNDER ATTACK.// (Pauses) //But I will go lie down, as I desire to rest for a short time.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]djkaktus[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2639[[/a]] ("Video Game Violence") - Mom was right when she said nothing good could come of playing violent video games... [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Great Hippo[[/a]] will rot your brains.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3140[[/a]] ("Botanical Warfare") - TIMBERRRRRRR! Planted by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]9Volt[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3501[[/a]] ("The Storyteller of Isfahan") - I am a new superstition entering the unassailable fortress of forever. Told by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Tufto[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3773[[/a]] ("9,000 Lives") - //The default 'form' of SCP-3773-# instances seems to be a chimeric mixture of all genetic information currently present in SCP-3773; fur will often appear to be in a patchwork pattern, eye colors are often heterochromatic, and in some cases, several tails, all functional, can appear.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Ihp[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3513[[/a]] ("The brain that ate itself") - Looks like something's eating away at you. What's in your mind? Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]psul[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3612[[/a]] ("The Mainlist is Out of Order; Please Try Again") - Ever wondered why we don't number SCPs sequentially? [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]GeometryPrime[[/a]] has the answer.
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3963[[/a]] ("I Contain Multitudes") - You don't want to know where this rabbit hole goes. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]shaggydredlocks[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2783[[/a]] ("Silent Lamentations of a Clockwork Goddess") - //A machine mind that gave his life to protect his builders, just as the Machine Goddess before him. There will always be a place in Paradise for those who gave of themselves as he did.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Agent MacLeod[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3235[[/a]] ("The Baba-disease") - //Within 72 hours of infection, tumorous growths will form on infected subjects1, including inside bodily cavities. Tissues comprising these growths are genetically identical to that of Migs Babache, a civilian of the city of [REDACTED].// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]xFox[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3979[[/a]] ("Will You Walk Into My Parlor?") - //The powerful will always prey on the weak, no matter how much the weak struggle. The fly does not wish to enter the parlour, so the parlour comes to him.// Woven by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Tufto[[/a]].
* 

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Battle of the Toys: Defense of Hive Skittles[[/a]] - //The Fortress-Monastery of the Inward Halo chapter stood proud, in its corner of Hive Skittles, known to the locals as Blocksville. The Space Marines of the revered chapter regularly interacted with the town populace, a callback to their hallowed lineage to the Salamanders of old.// Written by [*http://www.scp-wiki.net/s-xiaos-personnel-file Sad Xiao].

++++ GoI Formats

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]UIU File: 2014-014[[/a]] - Terrorists unleash a shark that eats concepts into Three Portlands. Just another day in [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Third Law[[/a]], by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]LordStonefish[[/a]] and [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]9volt[[/a]].

+++ Week of July 15th:

Hello blackness my old friend...

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3959[[/a]] ("The End of All Knowledge") - Knowledge is power. The Foundation has been rendered powerless. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Billith[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3702[[/a]] ("I Walk Through The Desert, And I Have No Name") - //I walk through endless sands, without food, water, or tongue. None shall help me.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]DrBleep[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-287[[/a]] ("Clark's Third Favorite Sword") - Whosoever holds this sword, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Thor! Wielded by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]DrMagnus[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3864[[/a]] ("I've Been Framed!") - Dorian Grey wishes he had this painting. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]taylor_itkin[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3071[[/a]] ("To Deny Sense") - The Beast is upon you. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Nekromykon[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3051[[/a]] ("Revenge of the Human Rights Lobbyists") - //Is that what you think we're doing? Turning people into puppets with magic compulsion? We're a human rights NGO, not a bad horror film.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Modern_Erasmus[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-41-D3N7E-J[[/a]] ("Lotsa Pasta") - Ravioli, ravioli, please shut up and leave me alone-i. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]trennerdios[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3470[[/a]] ("Harry Potter's Revenge") - It prowls the woods. It craves human flesh. And its engine is rated at over 900 cc. Driven by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]A Random Day[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3574[[/a]] ("Lambs to the Slaughter") - They are the problem. We are the solution. You are the lamb executioner. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]xFox[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3478[[/a]] ("A human shaped hole to the meat dimension") - It's easier to warp spacetime than it is to make bug spray. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Lex1nat0r[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3049[[/a]] ("To Make an Apple Pie from Scratch") - The Universe began with nothing, and will end with a delicious fruit-based pastry. Baked by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]rioludoodle[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-2694[[/a]] ("These Old Bones") - //SCP-2694 is an animated mass of objects currently in the shape of a Basset Hound (Canis lupus familiaris). The body is primarily composed of parts of stuffed animals, chew toys and children's toys.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Blaroth[[/a]].

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]No Safe Haven[[/a]] - The story of Stuart Hayward's childhood. Set in the [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Pitch Haven[[/a]], by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Fantem[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Reason Ulysses Doesn't Start With WARNING: IT'S GOT A BLOWJOB IN IT[[/a]] - //**hetcopogg:** seriously what's the context here you can't just say "someone drew a horny human girl version of my dog" and just leave it out there//. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Communism will win[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]A Life that Was Simple[[/a]] - Yaldabaoth just wants to return the world to a primordial chaos. Why won't others leave him be? Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SunnyClockwork[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Undoing[[/a]] - A trailer for the murder mystery of a lifetime. Part of the [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Glittering Horizon[[/a]], written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]LordStonefish[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Long Goodbye[[/a]] - In the sequel to [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Hartliss Detective Agency[[/a]], the intrepid private-eye pays a visit to the Baba Yaga of the South Side, but she isn't the only monster on the prowl. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Great Hippo[[/a]].

++++ GOI Formats

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Sounds of Silver[[/a]] - The [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Black Queens[[/a]] scramble to prevent an eldritch earworm from turning their worlds into pop-obsessed zombies. Ghostwritten by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Taffeta[[/a]].

++++ Author's Pages

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]xFox Author Page[[/a]] - Being the author page of [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]xFox[[/a]]!

+++ Week of July 22nd:

VROOM VROOM

++++ SCPs

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3666[[/a]] ("Repairing the Mask") - How far will the Foundation go to ensure containment? Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SpookyPizza[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-????-J[[/a]] ("Some fucking thing in a box") - //The thing is locked --tighter than Clef's butthole--.// Sealed by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Billith[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-930-J[[/a]] ("You little rascal!") - //SCP-930-J is a cute little ball of assorted tentacles and mouths, isn't it? I named it Daniel!// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Decibelles[[/a]].

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3252[[/a]] ("The Permian-Triassic Extinction Event") - //As far as the Foundation can determine, this period of time did not exist.// Excavated by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Rookierookie[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3722[[/a]] ("The City That Was Half the World") - //Beginning at sunrise, and finishing at sunset, the entire structure and layout of the city metamorphosises into a near-identical copy of itself from an earlier point in its history.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Tufto[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3839[[/a]] ("Liposlugtion: 2 Fat 2 Furious") - FEED ME. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Weryllium[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3313[[/a]] ("Poor Richard") - Benjamin Franklin's anomalous penis. Enough said. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Doctor Cimmerian[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-437[[/a]] ("Summer of '91") - If you put your ear up to the bark, you can hear them scream. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Great Hippo[[/a]].

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3070[[/a]] ("Highly Unusual Attempts at Solar Conquest") - A species that adapts to new environments is a species that survives. Even if the environments are asteroids. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]9Volt[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3560[[/a]] ("All Robots go to Limbo") - As it turns out, there's a robot purgatory. And they want to share it with you. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Jacob Conwell[[/a]].

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3418[[/a]] ("Devourer of Flames") - //In contrast to the comprehensive cell death in all other tissues, the central nervous system of SCP-3418-1 remain alive and fully functional despite lack of oxygen and vital nutrients, and is capable of surviving indefinitely.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Anborough[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3097[[/a]] ("A Game of Fetch") - When you give a dog a bone... Thrown by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Penton[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3338[[/a]] ("Otamatone wants to be your roommate~") - Hey, at least they pay their rent on time. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Zyn[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SCP-3635[[/a]] ("The Forgotten Archive") - //Not me, you twat, the other me. That me lived off the farm since we were born. I don't think I ever gone more than a few miles from it.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]YossiLeiner[[/a]].

++++ Tales

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]All That I Am[[/a]] - What is more important: a leader or the idea of a leader? Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Cyantreuse[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]In the Garden[[/a]] - A Foundation raid in another world. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Great Hippo[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]I Care Because You Do[[/a]] - A Karcist asks a Mekhanite for help with a murder investigation. With that, [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Blood Red Summer[[/a]] is underway. The sequel is [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Crossing the Frame[[/a]], all written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Taffeta[[/a]].

* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Triskaidekaphobia[[/a]] - //You are meeting O5-13, which is Death.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Chubert[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]The Glorious and Everlasting Victory of Pablo Foxenflower over the Traitor Lazarus Wyrm[[/a]]. Inventing scapegoats is hard work. Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Bennings[[/a]].
* [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]Welcome to History[[/a]] - //Before we begin, I would like to ask you to turn off your personal reality devices, or set them to Baseline Mode. Thaumiel Mode for those possessing reality-altering abilities and/or magical talents.// Written by [[a class="newpage" href="#"]]SunnyClockwork[[/a]].
